subject: Technology
title: Virtual Reality Gaming
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Virtual Reality Gaming.

hook.text: Put on a VR headset and you're not playing a game. You're inside one, looking around a world that doesn't exist.

buildup.text: VR gaming has been promised since the 1990s. Early headsets were expensive, heavy, and made people sick.

discovery.text: Meta's Quest headsets made VR affordable and wireless. No PC required, just put it on and play.

twist.text: Despite cheaper hardware, most people still use VR rarely. Headsets are isolating and tiring to wear.

climax.text: The gaming industry keeps betting on VR, believing the technology just needs one killer app to break through.

punchline.text: VR gaming is always five years away. It has been for thirty years.

quiz.question: What is the biggest barrier to widespread VR gaming adoption?
options: Headsets are isolating and tiring, and lack a killer app
